author: Will Willems - The Lebanon Reporter, Ind. (TNS)
title: Lady Tigers fall in opening game of tourney
text:
Dec. 27—LEBANON — The Lebanon girls basketball team lost a heartbreaker in the opening game of their annual holiday tournament Wednesday afternoon.
Perry Meridian topped the Lady Tigers 36-35, with the Tigers missing the second of two free throws with 1.5 seconds left that would have sent the game to overtime.
"It comes down to turnovers again, and wanting the ball in our hands," Lebanon head coach Candice Huckstep said. "We need someone out there stepping up and being a leader, and we don't have that right now. We knew this was going to be close, and free throws hurt us too, but it doesn't come down to that last possession. It just comes down to taking care of the ball, boxing out, and it was just disappointing."
After a Ciarra Hiatt basket with six seconds left cut the deficit to 35-34, Perry Meridian's Mariah Thomas was fouled and went to the line.
After making the first free throw, she missed the second and Lebanon's Claire Boling was fouled with 1.5 seconds left and had a chance to tie the game.
She made the first, but the second rimmed out and Perry Meridian got the rebound to seal the win.
"It unfortunately just didn't fall," Huckstep said. "We do a lot of pressure free throws in practice. Again, it didn't come down to that free throw. Obviously, we would have loved for it to go in, but it didn't come down to that one shot."
It a tough end to what had been a back-and-forth game throughout.
Lebanon led 29-26 at the end of three quarters, and took a 31-26 lead after a basket by Jade Mount.
Perry Meridian tied the game at 31, and after a free throw by Lebanon's Emily Sperry, the Falcons scored the next four points to go up 35-32.
The Tigers had the ball down three with 45 seconds to go, and had a lengthy possession where they had three attempts at the basket, but settled for Hiatt's two-pointer on a putback prior to the final seconds.
"We tried to let them to play through it a little bit," Huckstep said. "We had a game earlier this year where we didn't call timeout and it didn't work, and then the next time we did call timeout and that didn't work, so we have had it both ways. We were struggling to get the ball in and we thought it was best to let them play through."
The Tigers trailed 11-7 after a quarter, but dominated the second eight minutes.
Lebanon held the Falcons to just two points, and took a six point lead into the locker room.
The Tigers led by as many as eight on a 3-pointer by Leila Richards, but saw the Falcons close to within three by the end of the quarter.
"We have struggled all season with being able to keep a lead," Huckstep said. "There have been several games where we have a five, six, seven point leads and then just have too many turnovers and make bad decisions. Some of our decisions we are still making at this point of the season is a little disappointing."
Marina Barr led the Tigers with nine points, with Sperry scoring seven points and grabbing six rebounds.
Hiatt scored six points, with Boling having six points and nine rebounds.
The Tigers will now play in the consolations, facing Lafayette Jeff at 4 p.m. Wednesday.
"It's going to be all about mental toughness," Huckstep said. "We have to come in with a good mindset and listen to what we are trying to tell them coaching wise. The little details are going to matter against Lafayette Jeff. We played them in a scrimmage earlier this season, so we know a little about them and we know they aren't going to take it easy on us."
Will Willems is the Sports Editor of the Lebanon Reporter. Follow him on Twitter @Will_Willems.

www.reporter.net

Tribune Content Agency, LLC.

author: Europa Press
title: El Ayuntamiento recibe el premio a la Inclusión de la Asociación Autismo Jaén
text:
JAÉN, 18 Abr. (EUROPA PRESS) -
El Ayuntamiento de la capital ha recibido el premio a la Inclusión de la Asociación Autismo Jaén. El alcalde de la ciudad, Agustín González, ha recogido el galardón en el transcurso del acto de entrega de los I Premios Autismo Jaén, celebrado en la tarde de este jueves.
González ha agradecido a la entidad este reconocimiento, del que ha dicho que "si bien refrenda el trabajo del consistorio, a través de las distintas áreas municipales, para avanzar en la inclusión plena y en la mejora de la calidad de vida de las personas con autismo y sus familias, también nos impulsa a continuar ensanchando ese camino, reforzando las líneas de colaboración conjunta con la asociación y explorando nuevas formas para apoyar sus fines".
El alcalde ha asegurado que "desde el primer momento, este equipo de Gobierno ha tenido en la inclusión y la accesibilidad universal uno de sus objetivos; tanto es así que puso en marcha la Oficina Municipal de Inclusión y Accesibilidad, un organismo de carácter transversal a través del que se trabaja para que Jaén sea una ciudad para todos, cómoda y sin barreras de ningún tipo" al tiempo que ha insistido "en el compromiso firme y unánime del Gobierno municipal con Autismo Jaén para continuar poniendo en marcha medidas concretas o programas específicos encaminados a conseguir los propósitos de la entidad, que desde 1995 desarrolla servicios y apoyos especializados para las personas con este tipo de trastorno y sus familias en la provincia de Jaén".
INICIATIVAS MUNICIPALES DIRIGIDAS A PERSONAS CON TEA Por su parte, la directora de la Oficina Municipal de Inclusión y Accesibilidad, Elena Araque, ha destacado que "son múltiples las vías en las que trabajamos desde el Ayuntamiento para mejorar las condiciones de vida e integrar a personas con trastorno del espectro autista en diferentes eventos de la vida social" y ha puesto ejemplos concretos "como la reciente entrega de un kit para personas autistas a 15 niños y niñas, de manera que han podido disfrutar del partido que ha enfrentado al Real Jaén y al Torre del Mar en el Estadio Municipal de La Victoria".
"El objetivo de la iniciativa, que se ha llevado a cabo gracias a la colaboración de los patronatos de Asuntos Sociales y Deportes y la Oficina Municipal de Inclusión y Accesibilidad, era acercar a este colectivo a la vida pública y conseguir su inclusión plena en la sociedad a través del deporte; se trata de una experiencia piloto y, dado el éxito, se aplicará en otros ámbitos", ha añadido.
Araque ha agregado que, por otra parte, "el Ayuntamiento diseñó una Feria de San Lucas accesible el pasado año; estableció un día sin ruido, una caseta de accesibilidad y estipuló entrada prioritaria en las atracciones para niños con TEA. Asimismo, estos niños pudieron ver a los Reyes Magos con pase prioritario, sin hacer colas, o disfrutaron de un paseo navideño en el tren de Alsa para poder ver las luces de navidad de nuestra ciudad".
"Además, el Ayuntamiento de Jaén se ha sumado al Día Mundial de Concienciación sobre el Autismo, celebrado el 2 de abril. Con tal motivo se iluminó de azul su fachada, como muestra de apoyo y solidaridad con las personas con autismo y sus familias. Se trata de iniciativas que han dado excelentes resultados y que seguiremos reforzando, al tiempo que, en breve, pondremos en marcha otras nuevas que persiguen, asimismo, la integración y mejora de la vida de estas personas", ha añadido.
Leer más acerca de: Jaén

author: Business Standard
title: IMD weather today: Dense fog in Delhi-NCR, rain in Puducherry and more | India News - Business Standard
text:
The country's weather has drastically changed, with most areas experiencing extreme cold. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has warned of heavy fog over Delhi-NCR, Uttar Pradesh, and surrounding areas for the next two days due to the severe cold. It is anticipated that the fog would drastically impair visibility, affecting daily activities and transportation. Meanwhile, other southern states, including Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, and Karnataka, are expected to have significant rainfall, according to the weather department. IMD weather forecast 2024: Rainfall alert Heavy rains have disrupted many areas of Puducherry. According to RMC Tamil Nadu, from December 11 to December 16, an orange alert for severe to very heavy rain was issued. Palakkad, Malappuram, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Kozhikode and Wayanad districts are expected to see heavy rainfall today, while Pathanamthitta, Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Alappuzha, Kottayam, Ernakulam, Idukki, and Kasaragode districts are expected to have heavy rainfall on December 13. The majority of peninsular India, west-central India, and certain east-central and northeastern regions were expected to get above-normal rainfall, according to the weather service. In the meantime, a number of areas in east and north-east India, as well as a large part of north and north-west India, are expected to have rainfall that is normal to below normal. Weather update 2024: Winter alert People in a number of northern states, including Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, and Western Uttar Pradesh, have also been warned by the IMD that temperatures may soon drop. In some areas, the cold wave is likely going to get worse, with even lower minimum temperatures. One of the coldest days of the season has already been recorded in Delhi, with a minimum temperature of 4.5 degrees Celsius. The chilling effect of snow in the northern hills is being felt in the plains, as frost has started to form in many areas. Temperatures in states like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar are regularly dropping, making them extremely cold. title: Pakistan Cancels New Year's Celebrations in Solidarity with Gaza | Sada Elbalad
text:
Israa Farhan Pakistan has banned New Year's celebrations in solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza, announced the government on Thursday, urging citizens to observe "simple" forms of festivities.
In a televised message to the nation, Prime Minister Anwar ul Haq Kakar stated that due to the situation in Gaza, the government has "completely banned all types of New Year's celebration activities."
The conflict between Israel and Hamas erupted on October 7 following an unprecedented attack by the movement on southern Israel, resulting in the deaths of around 1,140 people, mostly civilians, according to a count by AFP based on the latest Israeli official figures.
The attack also led to the taking of about 250 hostages, with 129 of them still held in Gaza , according to Israel.
Since then, Israel has carried out intense shelling of Gaza and initiated ground operations starting on October 27, resulting in over 21,000 casualties, most of whom are women and children, according to the Ministry of Health controlled by Hamas.
Kakar stated on Thursday that "the entire Pakistani nation and the Muslim world deeply mourn the genocide of oppressed Palestinians, especially the massacre of innocent children in Gaza and the West Bank."
Pakistan typically celebrates New Year's Eve with fireworks and a bank holiday on January 1.
On Thursday, the Emirate of Sharjah in the United Arab Emirates also banned the launching of fireworks on New Year's Eve due to the war in Gaza.

author: commsmanager
title: Military Beats, Detains Christians Following Raid
text: In Kachin state, Northern Myanmar, military forces detained dozens of Christian leaders, pastors, and youth on Thursday on suspicion of aiding rebel forces in the country’s ongoing civil war. Radio Free Asia Burmese reported that roughly 100 soldiers initially detained more than 200 villagers in a school, where they were threatened and interrogated. Some were beaten, including local Christian leaders. The soldiers released the villagers after nearly nine hours of questioning about their ties to the Kachin Independent Army (KIA) and other anti-Junta militias. In recent months, two pastors were murdered, and numerous Christians have been harassed and beaten in Kachin state, which has a large Christian population. According to the 2020 Burmese Population and Housing Census Report, about 34% of Kachin state’s 1.6 million residents are Christians. Some advocacy groups estimate that that number is closer to two-thirds of the state’s population. The KIA has been hugely successful in Northern Myanmar recently, capturing and defeating several military junta camps. Subsequently, the junta forces are actively raiding Kachin villages, seeking information on KIA forces. For interviews, please email [[email protected]. ](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#cabab8afb9b98abaafb8b9afa9bfbea3a5a4e4a5b8ad)

author: AOL Staff
title: Tributes paid to ‘incredibly courageous’ surgeon Professor Sir Roy Calne
text: Tributes paid to ‘incredibly courageous’ surgeon Professor Sir Roy Calne Dame Esther Rantzen has paid tribute to an “incredibly courageous” surgeon who performed the first liver transplant in Europe. The former BBC journalist said Professor Sir Roy Calne, who died on Saturday aged 93, got in touch with her to ask for help to save a two-year-old boy who had weeks to live unless he found a donor. At the time, the numbers of transplant surgeries had fallen following a BBC Panorama programme that raised concerns about the field, she said. Despite the television industry’s concerns about transplants, Sir Roy contacted Dame Esther to put young Ben Hardwick, who was suffering with biliary atresia, on her TV show That’s Life!, she told the PA news agency. Dame Esther, 83, said: “He rang That’s Life!, we got a crew together that day and (Ben’s mother) made a speech in which she said that ‘this would be the greatest gift in life, and it might be the only comfort for a family whose only baby had passed away’ – we put her on the air, with quotes from Roy Calne, and it absolutely took off. “When (Ben’s mother) came to him and said ‘how can we change public opinion?’, and he said ‘television’, – I thought that was incredible, it was forgiving of the medium and it was also right, because at that time we were able to reach so many people and the rest of the media took it up too. “Within a week a donor was found. “He was not only a brilliantly skilled surgeon but he had immense courage. “I just think he was a wonderful example of a pioneering, brilliant medical practitioner in Britain working in the NHS.” She said a philanthropist offered to take Ben to America to get help after the show aired, but she responded “You don’t need to, we’ve got Professor Calne and he will do it under the NHS”. She added: “Roy performed the surgery on Ben and other children – as a result of our story people became aware of the desperate need for transplants.” The show started their friendship, she said, adding: “I have some beautiful watercolours by (Sir Roy) in pride of place in my home. “The thing about surgeons is they’re very, very gifted, good with their hands – he was also very talented artist. “He was funny, I remember having dinner with him. “I think it was steak and kidney pie and he carefully dissected one of the kidneys, which made it quite difficult to eat. “He was excellent company, but the thing that impressed me so much was the skill he had, the profession he was dedicated to.” Mike More, chair of Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust (CUH), paid tribute to Sir Roy on behalf of Cambridge University Hospitals, which named a transplant unit in the city’s Addenbrooke’s Hospital after the surgeon. He said: “I offer my deepest condolences to the family of Professor Sir Roy Calne. “He was a true pioneer of transplant surgery, not only carrying out many UK, European and world firsts in surgery but also inspiring future generations of clinicians. “Sir Roy leaves behind a truly amazing legacy and many of our staff will remember him with fondness for his vision and genuine kindness. We will all miss him very much.”

author: liliana carmona
title: Padre le ofrece 100 mil pesos a su yerno para que ya se case con su hija: video | Entretenimiento Cultura Pop | Univision
text:
Existen padres cuyo único deseo es ver a sus hijos adultos con una buena pareja. Este señor demostró que está dispuesto a pagar una fuerte suma de dinero a su yerno para que se case con su hija.
Padre ofrece miles de dólares al novio de su hija para que ya se casen; video se vuelve viral El usuario de TikTok @daypeppers compartió un video en el que un padre le ofrece una fuerte suma de dinero a su yerno para que se case con su hija. Pero no lo tomen a mal, ya que el señor ofreció aportar económicamente para que la joven tenga la boda de sus sueños.
“Si tú te casas con mi hija y la quieres bien, yo pongo 100 mil pesos (5 mil 913 dólares) para la boda (...) es neta”, expresa el señor. @daypeppers Jajaja ya para que se vaya de la casa ?
♬ sonido original - DayPeppers
De inmediato, la familia comienza a bromear con la situación, incluso su hermana menciona que ya quiere quitarse un problema ‘de encima’, mientras que su hermano se suma al cotorreo y le ofrece una consola de videojuegos para que ya se vaya de la casa.
El señor nuevamente se dirige a su yerno y le dice que el dinero estará disponible para la fecha que quieran, mientras que la joven solo pone cara de incomodidad.
Más sobre Historias virales
CULTURA POP Gypsy Rose Blanchard por fin es liberada de prisión: su terrible historia inspiró una serie 4 min de lectura
CULTURA POP Mujer con vitiligo recibe su primer Barbie y se emociona al ver que se parece a ella 3 min de lectura
CULTURA POP Como en 'Mi pobre angelito 2': aerolínea envió a un niño de 6 años en un vuelo equivocado 3 min de lectura
CULTURA POP Abuelito aprende a maquillar a su esposa con Parkinson y ella no puede contener las lágrimas: "Me veo hermosa" 2 min de lectura El video acumuló más de 772 mil reproducciones en un par de días y los internautas bromearon con la situación, preguntando si tenía otra hija, quien, curiosamente, es quien subió el video a la red social.
“¿No tiene otra hija, Don”, “Si él no quiere, yo me apunto por esos 100 mil”, “Es un buen suegro, ¿por qué esas cosas no me pasan a mí? Ah sí, ya me acordé”, “Si nos casamos, pero venimos a vivir con usted suegro”, “Si tu papá ya no te quiere en la casa, habrá señales” y “Y por mil pesos te llevas el play, jajaja”, fueron algunos de los textos.
La chica que subió el video no compartió más de esta cena navideña, por lo que no sabemos si la pareja aceptó el dinero para su boda, o si es que realmente piensan llegar al altar.
TikToker comparte cómo pedir dinero en la boda sin ser tan obvios En las bodas mexicanas es común que el novio pase con una serie de seguros y un plumón, para que en la camisa dejen un billete y le escriban alguna frase, mientras que la novia pasa con una zapatilla o una caja especial.
La usuaria @bodasymas.guru compartió 3 maneras en la que puedes evitarte todo esto y hacer la recaudación de dinero de una manera discreta, incluso elegante.
La experta señala que puedes incluir un sobre en la invitación y le pongas que el dinero será destinado para la luna de miel de los novios, o algún otro plan que tengan en mente. Una vez que llegue a la recepción habrá un caja con un letrero que indica que ahí pueden depositarlo.
@bodasymas.guru Pedir apoyo económico en la boda después de los gastos de la misma es añuna tradición que puedes hacer sin el famoso baile del dinero #bodas #baile #tradicionesmexicanas #bodasymas #dinero
♬ FEEL THE GROOVE - Queens Road, Fabian Graetz “La otra opción es poner una cajita con una leyenda que diga ‘apoyanos para nuestra luna de miel’ y ahí tus invitados pueden ir colocando el dinero”, expresó.
Mientras que la tercera opción incluye a las Damas de Honor, quienes pasarán mesa por mesa para pedir que cooperen con los novios con lo que puedan, explicando que sera para su viaje especial o algún otro proyecto que tengan.
¿Ayudarías económicamente a alguno de tus hijos para que tengan la boda de sus sueños? No olvides dejar tu opinión en la sección de comentarios.

author: VNExplorer
title: Fans call out 'sexist' double standard after chess player is fined over her 'sports shoes' - as official vows to revise dress code for future matches
text:
Anna-Maja Kazarian, 23, was fined $111 and told her posh Burberry sneakers were actually 'sports shoes' The popular young Dutch master has demanded to know what sport chess bosses think she could play in her thin-soled leisure shoesFans say the row highlights double standards for male and female players
A rising young star in the world of chess was left ‘feeling like a criminal’ after falling foul of a ban on sports shoes when she arrived for a game in a new pair of upmarket canvas Burberrys.
Anna-Maja Kazarian, 23, was fined $111 for wearing ‘strange shoes’ while competing at a tournament in Uzbekistan.
The rules specifically allow ‘sneakers’ and Kazarian is demanding to know what sports chess bosses think she could play in her thin-soled leisure shoes.
‘It hurts to even walk in those and I definitely don’t want to use my Burberry sneakers for sports,’ she said.
The young Dutch master who livestreams games to more than 34,000 followers on Twitch was among 330 entrants at the World Rapid and Blitz Championships in the former Soviet republic.
Anna-Maja Kazarian, 23, showed her thousands of YouTube followers the ‘sports shoes’ that landed her in trouble with the game’s authorities
Russian grandmaster and tournament official Pavel Tregubov was unforgiving when she complained about the sanction
Kazarian demanded to know what sports chess bosses think she could play in her thin-soled Burberry leisure shoes
She was half-way through a game when she became aware that the authorities were displeased.
‘I see a big yellow sign stating official warning dress code, it’s a huge yellow sign that you just can’t miss and I see it in the corner of my eye like a flash.
‘And I already know it’s going to be for me because he’s walking around and there’s no way that in those 10 boards there’s going to be someone else allegedly violating the dress code.
‘During the game I’m spending a lot of my time thinking about what is going on, what do I do if I get this warning?
Kazarian was half way through her match when she saw the official warning from the corner of her eye
‘Am I going to change my shoes? How? Do I go to my room? Do I get expelled from the tournament.’
The row has once again thrown light on FIDE, the game’s governing body which was rocked by claims that American chess prodigy Hans Niemann used ‘vibrating anal beads’ to beat world number one Magnus Carlsen in 2022.
Niemann sued for $100 million Carlsen after the Norwegian repeated online rumors that he had been told what moves to play through buzzes from a coach transmitted to a sex toy hidden in his body.
‘It must be embarrassing for the world champion to lose to me,’ he told reporters.
‘I feel bad for him!’
He credited a ‘ridiculous miracle’, for his victory, claiming he had watched a video of Carlsen using a similar game plan in a game four years earlier that morning.
The pair settled out of court but the story gained an unexpected afterlife this week when a champion of Xiangqi, the Chinese variant of the game, was accused of using the technique to win the title of ‘Xiangqi King’ at a tournament in the country.
Kazarian was all smiles as she arrived in her shoes for the day’s play unaware that she was about to clash with the game’s authorities
Kazarian was the 2020 Dutch Women’s Internet Chess Champion and has also been an under-16 girls’ European Youth Champion
Yan Chenglong (pictured, right) defecated in a hotel bathroom, and is accused of using anal beads to cheat at the Chinese Xiangqi Association competition
Nineteen-year-old chess prodigy Hans Niemann previously declared he would play naked to prove doubters wrong after rumors suggested he could have used vibrating anal beads
The sport was left in uproar on Monday when national champion Yan Chenglong was stripped off his title after being accused of defecating in a hotel bathroom.
‘Yan consumed alcohol with others in his room on the night of the 17th, and then he defecated in the bathtub of the room he was staying in on the 18th,’ the Chinese Xiangqi Association said in a statement.
‘An act that damaged hotel property, violated public order and good morals, had a negative impact on the competition and the event of Xiangqi, and was of extremely bad character.’
‘Based on our understanding of the situation, it is currently impossible to prove that Yan engaged in cheating via ‘anal beads’ as speculated on social media,’ it added.
Chess fans on social media were quick to point out male players who have not been sanctioned for wearing sports shoes.
‘As a PE teacher I can tell you those are most certainly not sport shoes,’ tweeted @chesslete.
‘They’re sports shoes if you were playing in the NBA 60 years ago,’ added les miens miserables.
The match shook up the chess world – after Niemann, a rising talent from San Francisco, unceremoniously defeated the Norwegian world at last year’s prestigious Sinquefield Cup
‘Not so much these days.’
Pavel Tregubov, FIDE’s technical delegate at the tournament apologized for the upset and said that the governing body is planning to revise its dress code.
‘If she felt like a criminal, I’m very sorry for that,’ he added.
‘Usually the arbiters are shy,’ he added, ‘It’s not like in football.’

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Kamala Harris Slams Calls for Ukraine to Cede Territory to Russia | Politics
text: Kamala Harris Slams Calls for Ukraine to Cede Territory to Russia Vice President Kamala Harris denounced suggestions by Donald Trump and JD Vance for Ukraine to cede territory to Russia as 'dangerous and unacceptable' during a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington. Harris pledged continued military support for Ukraine amidst partisan divides in the U.S. presidential race. [Devdiscourse News Desk](/devdiscourse-stories)| Washington DC | Updated: 27-09-2024 02:02 IST | Created: 27-09-2024 02:02 IST - Country: - United States Vice President Kamala Harris strongly criticized proposals by Donald Trump and Ohio Sen. JD Vance for Ukraine to cede territory to Russia, labeling them as 'dangerous and unacceptable'. Harris made the comments during a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington. Harris, the Democratic vice-presidential nominee, pledged continued military assistance to Ukraine if elected, emphasizing that suggestions from her Republican opponents were not peace proposals but 'proposals for surrender'. While in Washington, Zelenskyy sought to solidify U.S. support for Ukraine's defense as the war against Russia becomes increasingly politicized ahead of the U.S. presidential election. President Joe Biden also reaffirmed his commitment to support Ukraine with additional military aid before leaving office. (With inputs from agencies.)
